Function reference

version 1.0.0.9000

Read rectangular files

Read a delimited file (including csv & tsv) into a tibble

  • read_delim
  • read_csv
  • read_csv2
  • read_tsv

Read a fixed width file into a tibble

  • read_fwf
  • fwf_empty
  • fwf_widths
  • fwf_positions

Read common/combined log file into a tibble

  • read_log

Read whitespace-separated columns into a tibble

  • read_table

Column specification

Create column specification

  • cols
  • cols_only

Retrieve parsing problems

  • problems
  • stop_for_problems

Generate a column specification

  • spec_delim
  • spec_csv
  • spec_csv2
  • spec_tsv
  • spec_table

Examine the column specifications for a data frame

  • cols_condense
  • spec

Column parsers

Each parser comes in two forms: parse_xxx() which is used to parse vectors that already exist in R and col_xxx() which is used to parse vectors as they are loaded by a read_xxx() function.

Skip a column

  • col_skip

Parse logicals, integers, and reals

  • parse_logical
  • parse_integer
  • parse_double
  • parse_character
  • col_logical
  • col_integer
  • col_double
  • col_character

Parse date/times

  • parse_datetime
  • parse_date
  • parse_time
  • col_datetime
  • col_date
  • col_time

Parse factors

  • parse_factor
  • col_factor

Parse using the "best" type

  • parse_guess
  • col_guess
  • guess_parser

Parse numbers, flexibly

  • parse_number
  • col_number

Locale controls

The “locale” controls all options that vary from country-to-country or language-to-language. See vignette("locales") for more details.

Create or retrieve date names

  • date_names
  • date_names_lang
  • date_names_langs

Create locales

  • locale
  • default_locale

Write rectangular files

Despite its name, readr also provides a number of functions to write data frames to disk, and to convert them to in-memory strings.

Convert a data frame to a delimited string

  • format_delim
  • format_csv
  • format_tsv

Write a data frame to a delimited file

  • write_delim
  • write_csv
  • write_excel_csv
  • write_tsv

Low-level IO and debugging tools

These functions can be used with non-rectangular files, and to help debug rectangular files that fail to parse.

Count the number of fields in each line of a file

  • count_fields

Guess encoding of file

  • guess_encoding

Read/write a complete file

  • read_file
  • read_file_raw
  • write_file

Read/write lines to/from a file

  • read_lines
  • read_lines_raw
  • write_lines

Re-convert character columns in existing data frame

  • type_convert

Chunked API

The chunked API allows you to read in files that are larger than memory, processing a chunk at a time. The API experimental: please try it out but be aware that it may change in the future.

Callback classes

  • callback
  • ChunkCallback
  • SideEffectChunkCallback
  • DataFrameCallback

Read a delimited file by chunks

  • read_delim_chunked
  • read_csv_chunked
  • read_csv2_chunked
  • read_tsv_chunked

Read lines from a file or string by chunk.

  • read_lines_chunked

readr is a part of the tidyverse, an ecosystem of packages designed with common APIs and a shared philosophy. Learn more at tidyverse.org.

Developed by Hadley Wickham, Jim Hester, Romain Francois, , Jukka Jylänki, Mikkel Jørgensen.
